alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 16 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York, including the following county, Essex. Portions of central Vermont, including the following county, Addison. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moriah, Port Henry, D A R State Park, Addison, Panton, Mineville, Witherbee, Moriah Center, Mullen Bay, Craig Harbor, Stevenson Bay, Crane Point, Bulwagga Bay, Elm Point, Owls Head Bay, Oven Point, Chimney Point, Coffin Point, New Russia and West Addison. - Flooding was reported on Tarbell Hill Rd. Additional flooding has been reported along Route 22 in the town of Westport as of 4:20 PM. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
